intro: Haemodorum edule, commonly known as the edible mountain ginger, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their striking red flowers. The plant has underground rhizomes that are used in traditional Aboriginal cuisine, often prepared as a vegetable. Its leaves are lance-shaped and can grow up to 30 cm in length, while the flowers are typically bright red or orange. Haemodorum edule thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
